page.title: 17Old Hartley Hero
page.content: Half a mile North of Curry's point is Hartley Bay. On October 28th 1880, the Dutch Galleon{"Trebroders"}was passing Hartley Bay in a raging sea when she ran onto the rocks at Crag Point. The remaining crew were clinging to the rigging. Then the figure of Thomas Langley appeared at the top of the cliff and without hesitation he said he should be lowered down onto the raging sea. He saved a child and two seamen. As Langley was returning to his cottage a cry was heard that another ship was in distress.
